org.perfcake.reporting.destination.c3chart

Class C3ChartHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfcake.reporting.destination.c3chart.C3ChartHelper

  • public class C3ChartHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for the ChartDestination. Bridges the destination methods to the corresponding actions of other classes in the package.
    Author:
    Martin Večeřa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      C3ChartHelper(ChartDestination chartDestination)
      Creates a new helper for the given ChartDestination.

    • Constructor Detail

      • C3ChartHelper

        public C3ChartHelper(ChartDestination chartDestination)
        Creates a new helper for the given ChartDestination.
        Parameters:
        chartDestination - The ChartDestination this helper is supposed to serve to.

    • Method Detail

      • appendResult

        public void appendResult(Measurement measurement)
                  throws ReportingException
        Appends the results in the current Measurement to the main chart.
        Parameters:
        measurement - The current measurement.
        Throws:
        ReportingException - When it was not possible to append the results.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Is the helper properly initialized?
        Returns:
        True if and only if the helper was properly initialized.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws PerfCakeException
        Closes the data files.
        Throws:
        PerfCakeException - When it was not possible to smoothly finalize the data files.

      • compileResults

        public void compileResults(boolean autoCombine)
                    throws PerfCakeException
        Creates the final result report compiling all the previous charts together.
        Parameters:
        autoCombine - True if we should combine the new results with the previous reports.
        Throws:
        PerfCakeException - When there was an error creating the report. Typically an I/O issue.
